column3:
As I said, the original uninstall icon remains the same. Not sure if we should change that as well - maybe with [bitcoin logo all in black](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/0.16/src/qt/res/icons/about.png)?

![Screenshot_84](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42591821/63968238-c58c8c00-ca8e-11e9-8a6a-74b57361f301.png)

I decided to add a black icon, sizes 64px - 16px, RGBA and RGB. Reason: might also come in handy in the future for something else, and the uninstall icon display will not be dependent on registry values.

![about](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42591821/64014621-1f826580-cb12-11e9-83e1-372924603ba3.png)
Actually I think you could revert to 635e9154da223ca760713d7b3b66c0a9321d1277, it just fixes the icon. Let's discuss the black icon elsewhere?\n\nACK 635e9154da223ca760713d7b3b66c0a9321d1277.
@promag: dropped the last commit. Will create a new PR with the icon as suggested

I don't think so. It was backslashes because that was NSIS directory which I think only appears when installing on Windows.\nThe pixmaps/icons are in the source folder. Take a look at how bitcoin-qt.exe icon is defined:\n`!define MUI_ICON "@abs_top_srcdir@/share/pixmaps/bitcoin.ico"`
